title: Katie Price ‘wants nation to fall in love with her again’ on Celebrity SAS
text:
Katie Price is apparently on Celebrity SAS (Picture: Channel 4/YouTube)

Katie Price is apparently hoping to win over the nation’s hearts on Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins, so people can see she’s still the ‘old Katie’.

The 41-year-old reality star is believed to have signed up for the Channel 4 series to raise money for Stand Up To Cancer, which sees contestants put through intense SAS training from former soldiers Ant Middleton and Jason Fox.

According to the Mail Online, Katie jetted off on Tuesday to start filming, and has signed up to show audiences she’s still the same person as she was on 2004’s I’m A Celebrity.

Speaking to the publication, a source said: ‘The show is the perfect outlet for her to boost her confidence and regain her fitness.

‘When she left, she was so excited to get stuck in. She wants people to see she’s still the old Katie that the nation fell in love with in I’m A Celeb.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Metro.co.uk has reached out to Katie’s reps for comment.

Katie has had a difficult past few months, ranging from facing bankruptcy, driving bans, and a turbulent love life.

She previously won I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here back in 2004, after striking up a romance with now ex-husband Peter Andre.

The first ever edition of Celebrity SAS aired earlier this year, featuring the likes of Made In Chelsea’s Sam Thompson, actor Jeremy Irvine and eventual winner Wayne Bridge.

Ahead of Katie’s supposed appearance on the next series, Katie posted a video on her YouTube channel declaring she was training for a ‘top secret project’.

Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins is expected to return on Channel 4 in 2020.

description: Katie Price is apparently hoping to prove she's the same 'old Katie' on Celebrity SAS.
